channel.title: [Shards] Creative-scape request client developer
channel.description:
R0cky 0wnz needs a client developer to help him. The source is project no-doze and base is shards.
The server always has 100+ players, max we reached is 210 players and is growing rapidly.
Few problems are 1. Random disconnection happens. 2. Random glitch that makes no sense.
If you are interested, I will pm you the website so you can pm the owner on the forums.

item.title: [Shards] Creative-scape request client developer
item.dc:creator: @dawsonsmokes dawsonsmokes
item.description:
@dawsonsmokes wrote:

[quote=“Kodiak, post:2, topic:526156”]First off: We’re all quite aware of cs. You don’t have to brag about the playercount, I’m pretty sure no one cares.
Second: No direct asking of developers, especially through this board. If he wants a developer, he can start a team or come on this website and pm individuals he particularly thinks would be interested and see what they say.
Third: (Just an opinion) I don’t think anyone would want to develop for a server where the owner himself is so lazy he can’t even ask a question (that’s in the wrong section at that!) regarding his own staff/development team.[/quote]

Well said and goodluck with shard. Shitty to use but whatever. If anything I sugguest he should of used hyperion or Apollo

Read full topic

item.title: [Shards] Creative-scape request client developer
item.dc:creator: @Kodiak Kodiak
item.description:
@Kodiak wrote:

First off: We’re all quite aware of cs. You don’t have to brag about the playercount, I’m pretty sure no one cares.
Second: No direct asking of developers, especially through this board. If he wants a developer, he can start a team or come on this website and pm individuals he particularly thinks would be interested and see what they say.
Third: (Just an opinion) I don’t think anyone would want to develop for a server where the owner himself is so lazy he can’t even ask a question (that’s in the wrong section at that!) regarding his own staff/development team.

Read full topic
